relation: Campus security are always visible and alert, and the campus conduct workshops on safety periodically throughout the semesters.
Women's Studies Club Islamic Students Associations Chess Club African Students Association
For fun, there are a variety of club and groups at your disposal, as well as various art exhibits and performances focused on enlightenment and academic achievement

The cafe at Montgomery College is ever expanding, a new vegan menu has just been added to the cafe's menu and it is great. The cafe often offer rewards to students who take their survey. I believe employment opportunities are offered as well.
Montgomery college does not have dorms. You can however, find affordable housing around the surrounding area. The Silver spring metro is close by as well.

The work is indeed tough, however, the professors are extremely professional and helpful. If you play your part as a student you will never find yourself without the necessary tools to complete class assignments and test.
Register for financial aid, grants and loans early because classes fill-up.

Montgomery College has been a home away from home. It has provided me with opportunities and inspiration I never experienced before. I would recommend this community college to anyone looking to further their eduction in a pleasant, peaceful environment.
pageTitle: Montgomery College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {247120=I am a full-time student for the fall 2012 semester and I pay less than $3,500.00 including the costs of textbooks and other course required materials., 60498=Montgomery is for the students that have known each other for years; I've been attending this school since August and haven't met any new friends, besides the one I had in high school., 14827=Montgomery College is very affordable (~$2000 a semester depending on how many credits you take)., 573559=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 522883=The classes are good overall it all depends on the professor as well. Some of the classes are harder here than at a university so when you transfer its much easier that community college. If i could rate the college on the scale of 1-10 I would give the school a 9.5-10., 465536=The classes are not high, there is always financial aid help; and some teachers give out scholarships. Last semester I took 3 classes and my bill was $1600, which is pretty good for a community college.}

textAfterTable: Clubs and Activities clubs and activities abound. when you have students from over 130 countries, world cultures collide and you can end up with the black student union, the club from viet nam, the architects club that takes field trips to nyc, the christian life club or you can create your own club, there are also sports teams and then there are individual events throughout the year such as a well known writer lecturing on a campus one day or international womens history day with scheduled speakers open to the college community for free, or volunteer efforts to help out people in world disasters are just a few of the many clubs and activities. Great for these types of students this college is great for people that want a top quality college learning experience without footing the bill of a private education. a very popular esl program as well as various learning options for non traditional students or students that cannot stop working or have family responsibilities and cannot commute to college there is online learning, learning via the tv, night classes, weekend classes, independent studies, co-operative education opportunities as well as a seamless transition for county public school students to montgomery college and beyond. endless possibilities. excellent disability office where students fill out forms and provide medical documentation for acomodations for college courses.
